alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued March 11 at 9:07PM EDT until March 13 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Monday evening, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to three feet above normal. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 11/04 PM 2.5 0.9 1.2 1.0 None 12/06 AM 3.2 1.6 1.6 0.5 Minor 12/06 PM 3.6 2.0 2.3 1.0 Moderate 13/07 AM 4.1 2.5 2.5 1.0 Moderate 13/06 PM 3.6 2.0 2.4 1.0 Moderate 14/07 AM 3.2 1.6 1.7 2.0 Minor &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
